newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Dec 12.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Dec 12.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Bangladesh and India are expected to sign a long-term agreement on sharing of the Ganges water on Thursday ending two-decade-old dispute between the two neighbours.
The Amnesty International has expressed concern over reported police repression on citizens and urged the government to investigate into such incidents of police violence.
India's Prime Minister Deve Gowda is expectd to pay a brief visit to Bangladesh on December 16 to participate in the silver jubilee celebration of the country's liberation war.
The World Bank is likely to go for spot audits of the bank-funded development programmes to check corruption.

Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, now visiting Delhi, said on Wednesday that a deal on Ganges water sharing would be a "momentous occasion" in relations between Bangladesh and India and a "stepping stone" for a greater bilateral cooperation.
The government on Wednesday constituted a four-member committee to suggest a policy on the "circuit breaker" which now restricts price movements in the stock market.
Bangladesh on Wednesday called for consensus on issues to be incorporated in the declaration of the first ministreal conference of World Trade Organisation (WTO) in Singapore.
Bangladesh has about 6.3 million child labourers of whom 0.32 percent are working as sex workers, Unicef officials said in Dhaka on Wednesday.
